problem_text: If L K = 4, M P = 3, P Q = 6, K J = 2, R S = 6, and L P = 2, find J H.
proof:
Step 1:
Theorem: Known facts
Premises : start
Conclusions: KM, K on HM, 2 = LP, KQ, HS || KQ, 4 = KL, ∠PMH, 3 = MP, MQ, KQ || LP, JR || KQ, ∠QMH, L on JM, 2 = JK, L on HM, JR || LP, 6 = PQ, L on KM, J on HM, 6 = RS, K on JL, R on MS, P on MQ

Step 2:
Theorem: Corresponding Angle Theorem
Premises : HS || KQ
Conclusions: ∠MHS = ∠MKQ, ∠MQK = ∠MSH

Step 3:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : KQ, MQ, KM
Conclusions: △KMQ

Step 4:
Theorem: Corresponding Angle Theorem
Premises : KQ || LP
Conclusions: ∠MPL = ∠MQK, ∠MKQ = ∠MLP

Step 5:
Theorem: Corresponding Angle Theorem
Premises : JR || KQ
Conclusions: ∠MJR = ∠MKQ

Step 6:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : K on HM, ∠QMH
Conclusions: ∠QMH = ∠QMK

Step 7:
Theorem: Line Segment Split
Premises : L on JM
Conclusions: JM = JL + LM

Step 8:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 2 = JK, 4 = KL
Conclusions: 6 = JK + KL

Step 9:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 2 = JK, 2 = LP
Conclusions: JK = LP

Step 10:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : L on HM, ∠PMH
Conclusions: ∠PMH = ∠PML

Step 11:
Theorem: Corresponding Angle Theorem
Premises : JR || LP
Conclusions: ∠MPL = ∠MRJ

Step 12:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 6 = PQ, 3 = MP
Conclusions: 9 = MP + PQ

Step 13:
Theorem: Line Segment Split
Premises : L on KM
Conclusions: KM = KL + LM

Step 14:
Theorem: Line Segment Split
Premises : J on HM
Conclusions: HM = HJ + JM

Step 15:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 6 = PQ, 6 = RS
Conclusions: PQ = RS

Step 16:
Theorem: Line Segment Split
Premises : K on JL
Conclusions: JL = JK + KL

Step 17:
Theorem: Line Segment Split
Premises : R on MS
Conclusions: MS = MR + RS

Step 18:
Theorem: Line Segment Split
Premises : P on MQ
Conclusions: MQ = MP + PQ

Step 19:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠QMH, P on MQ
Conclusions: ∠PMH = ∠QMH

Step 20:
Theorem: Angle-Angle Similarity Theorem
Premises : ∠MHS = ∠MKQ, ∠MQK = ∠MSH
Conclusions: △HMS ~ △KMQ

Step 21:
Theorem: Perimeter Definition
Premises : △KMQ
Conclusions: Perimeter(△KMQ) = KM + KQ + MQ

Step 22:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠MPL = ∠MRJ, ∠MPL = ∠MQK
Conclusions: ∠MQK = ∠MRJ

Step 23:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : JL = JK + KL, 6 = JK + KL
Conclusions: 6 = JL

Step 24:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : MQ = MP + PQ, 9 = MP + PQ
Conclusions: 9 = MQ

Step 25:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠PMH = ∠QMH, ∠PMH = ∠PML
Conclusions: ∠PML = ∠QMH

Step 26:
Theorem: Similar Definition
Premises : △HMS ~ △KMQ
Conclusions: ∠MQK = ∠MSH, HM / KM = MS / MQ

Step 27:
Theorem: Angle-Angle Similarity Theorem
Premises : ∠MQK = ∠MRJ, ∠MJR = ∠MKQ
Conclusions: △JMR ~ △KMQ

Step 28:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 9 = MQ, 3 = MP
Conclusions: 3 = MQ / MP

Step 29:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠PML = ∠QMH, ∠QMH = ∠QMK
Conclusions: ∠PML = ∠QMK

Step 30:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 9 = MQ, HM / KM = MS / MQ
Conclusions: MS / 9 = HM / KM

Step 31:
Theorem: Similar Definition
Premises : △JMR ~ △KMQ
Conclusions: sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q = MR / MQ, MR / MQ = Perimeter(△JMR) / Perimeter(△KMQ), JM / KM = MR / MQ, ∠MQK = ∠MRJ

Step 32:
Theorem: Angle-Angle Similarity Theorem
Premises : ∠PML = ∠QMK, ∠MPL = ∠MQK, ∠MKQ = ∠MLP
Conclusions: △KMQ ~ △LMP

Step 33:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 9 = MQ, sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q = MR / MQ
Conclusions: sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q = MR / 9

Step 34:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : MR / MQ = Perimeter(△JMR) / Perimeter(△KMQ), 9 = MQ
Conclusions: MR / 9 = Perimeter(△JMR) / Perimeter(△KMQ)

Step 35:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 9 = MQ, JM / KM = MR / MQ
Conclusions: MR / 9 = JM / KM

Step 36:
Theorem: Similar Definition
Premises : △KMQ ~ △LMP
Conclusions: sim_ratio_triangle_k_m_q_triangle_l_m_p = KQ / LP, ∠PML = ∠QMK, sim_ratio_triangle_k_m_q_triangle_l_m_p = KM / LM, sim_ratio_triangle_k_m_q_triangle_l_m_p = MQ / MP, ∠MKQ = ∠MLP

Step 37:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q = MR / 9
Conclusions: 9 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q = MR

Step 38:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : sim_ratio_triangle_k_m_q_triangle_l_m_p = MQ / MP, 3 = MQ / MP
Conclusions: 3 = sim_ratio_triangle_k_m_q_triangle_l_m_p

Step 39:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3 = sim_ratio_triangle_k_m_q_triangle_l_m_p, sim_ratio_triangle_k_m_q_triangle_l_m_p = KM / LM
Conclusions: 3 = KM / LM

Step 40:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3 = sim_ratio_triangle_k_m_q_triangle_l_m_p, sim_ratio_triangle_k_m_q_triangle_l_m_p = KQ / LP
Conclusions: 3 = KQ / LP

Step 41:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 3 = KM / LM, 4 = KL, KM = KL + LM
Conclusions: 6 = KM

Step 42:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 3 = KM / LM, 6 = JL, 4 = KL, KM = KL + LM, JM = JL + LM
Conclusions: 8 = JM

Step 43:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 9 = MQ, JK = LP, 6 = JK + KL, 3 = KM / LM, Perimeter(△KMQ) = KM + KQ + MQ, 3 = KQ / LP, 2 = LP, KM = KL + LM
Conclusions: 21 = Perimeter(△KMQ)

Step 44:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 6 = PQ, PQ = RS, 6 = KM
Conclusions: KM = RS

Step 45:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : MS / 9 = HM / KM, 6 = KM
Conclusions: HM / 6 = MS / 9

Step 46:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : MR / 9 = JM / KM, 6 = KM, 8 = JM, 9 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q = MR
Conclusions: 8 / 6 = (9 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q) / 9

Step 47:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 6 = KM, 8 = JM
Conclusions: 1.33 = JM / KM

Step 48:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 8 = JM, JM = JL + LM
Conclusions: 8 = JL + LM

Step 49:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 21 = Perimeter(△KMQ), MR / 9 = Perimeter(△JMR) / Perimeter(△KMQ), 9 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q = MR
Conclusions: (9 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q) / 9 = Perimeter(△JMR) / 21

Step 50:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : (9 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q) / 9 = Perimeter(△JMR) / 21, 8 / 6 = (9 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q) / 9
Conclusions: 8 / 6 = Perimeter(△JMR) / 21

Step 51:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : (9 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q) / 9 = Perimeter(△JMR) / 21, 8 / 6 = Perimeter(△JMR) / 21, 8 = JL + LM, KM = RS, 1.33 = JM / KM, HM = HJ + JM, JM = JL + LM, HM / 6 = MS / 9, MS = MR + RS, 9 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q = MR
Conclusions: 4 = HJ
